sen.j: 京都府立植物園（きょうとふりつしょくぶつえん）とは、京都市左京区にある植物園。
sen.e: The Kyoto Prefectural Botanical Garden is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The Kyoto Prefectural Botanical Garden is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The Kyoto Prefectural Botanical Garden is located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 日本で最初の公立植物園として、1924年(大正13年)1月1日に開園した。
sen.e: It was Japan's first public botanical garden which opened on January 1, 1924.
It was Japan's first public botanical garden which opened on January 1, 1924.
It was Japan's first public botanical garden which opened on January 1, 1924.

sen.j: 1946年(昭和21年)から12年間は連合軍に接収され閉園を余儀なくされたが、1961年(昭和36年)4月に再開した。
sen.e: It had been forced to close since 1946 because it was confiscated by the allied forces for 12 years until April 1961 when it re-opened.
sen.cmt: 計算が合いませんがそのまま訳してあります．1946+12=1958 not 1961
sen.e: It was forced to close in 1946 as it was confiscated by the allied forces for 12 years, but re-opened in April 1961.
sen.cmt: 「had been」→「was」, 「since」→「in」,「because」→「as」,「until April 1961 when it reopened」→「, but re-opened in April1961」
sen.e: It was forced to close in 1946 as it was confiscated by the allied forces for twelve years, but re-opened in April 1961.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 園内には面積24ヘクタールの広大な敷地に約12000種類、約12万本の植物が植えられている。
sen.e: On its expansive grounds measuring 240,000 m2, approximately 120,000 plants of approximately 12,000 kinds are planted.
There are approximately 120,000 plants, and in the region of 12,000 varieties, in the extensive grounds covering 240,000m2.
There are approximately 120,000 plants, and in the region of 12,000 varieties, in the extensive grounds covering 240,000 square meters.

sen.j: 日本の四季の花が見られる花壇や洋風庭園、熱帯植物を集めた温室がある。
sen.e: It has a Japanese flower garden for all four seasons, Western-style gardens, and a greenhouse for tropical plants.
It has a Japanese flower garden for all four seasons, Western-style gardens, and a greenhouse for tropical plants.
It has a Japanese flower garden for all four seasons, Western-style gardens, and a greenhouse for tropical plants.

sen.j: 北半分は半木（なからぎ）の森と呼ばれる自然に近い森を利用した生態植物園などがある。
sen.e: Northern half of it is an ecological-botanical garden dedicated to a nearly wild wood called "Nakaragi-no-mori" (半木の森).
The northern half is an ecological-botanical garden dedicated to a wood called "Nakaragi-no-mori" (半木の森) which has been created to resemble a wood in the wild.
The northern half is an ecological-botanical garden dedicated to a wood called "Nakaragi-no-mori" (半木の森) which has been created to resemble a wood in the wild.
Access
Access

Main gate
Main gate
Main gate

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄 北大路駅より鴨川 (淀川水系)を渡り約1km
sen.e: From Kitaoji Station of Kyoto City Subway, go over Kamo-gawa River (part of Yodo-gawa River) and walk 1 km.
From Kitaoji Station on the Kyoto City Subway, go over Kamo-gawa River (part of Yodo-gawa River) and walk 1 km.
From Kitaoji Station on the Kyoto Municipal Subway, go over the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) and walk one kilometer.
sen.cmt: Municipal としました。"Kamo-gawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都市営バス 植物園前停留所
sen.e: Take Kyoto City Bus and get off at "Shokubutsuen Mae" bus stop, which is close to the gate.
Take the Kyoto City Bus and get off at "Shokubutsuen Mae" bus stop, which is close to the gate.
Take the Kyoto City Bus and get off at "Shokubutsuen Mae" bus stop, which is close to the gate.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄 北山駅 (京都府)
sen.e: Close to Kitayama Station of Kyoto City Subway.
Close to Kitayama Station on the Kyoto City Subway.
Close to Kitayama Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kyoto Municipal Subway.
sen.cmt: 京都府 追加しました。

sen.j: 京都市営バス 植物園北門前停留所
sen.e: Close to "Shokubutsuen Kitamon Mae" bus stop of Kyoto City Bus.
Close to "Shokubutsuen Kitamon Mae" bus stop using the Kyoto City Bus.
Close to "Shokubutsuen Kitamon Mae" bus stop using the Kyoto City Bus.
